Texts.Eng: A detailed model of Sol, the yellow dwarf responsible for all life on Earth. It even casts light.
I would stare at the Sun for hours when at the Academy. I'll sure miss that.
My home star, the Sun. I'll always remember the view from Earth at sunset...
Sadness. I wonder when I'll be able to see the Sun with my own eyes again.
The Sssun. Despite the destruction of Earth it ssstill shines brightly.
The Sun. The centre of the Sol System. It's a yellow dwarf which count as roughly 7.6% of all main-sequence stars.
The star of the Sol System and a G-type main-sequence star that serves at the accepted interstellar standard for defining solar mass.
The star of the Sol System. It's not dissimilar from one of the twin stars of my own home system.
